com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.puz
Class PUZPuzzleInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.PuzzleInputStream<PUZPuzzle>
          com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.puz.PUZPuzzleInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
public class PUZPuzzleInputStream
extends PuzzleInputStream<PUZPuzzle>

Serializes a PUZPuzzle object into a PUZ image as an InputStream. The image created by this class is in version 1.3 of the PUZ format.

The validate() method of this class may be used to verify that a given PUZPuzzle object has sufficient integrity to be serialized.

Author:
Eric Peterson
See Also:
PuzzleInputStream, The PUZ Project

Constructor Detail

public PUZPuzzleInputStream()
Method Detail

toByteArray

public byte[] toByteArray()
                   throws java.io.IOException
Serializes a PUZPuzzle object into a PUZ file image. PUZ file image extra sections will be created only if necessary. If the unlockCode property of the puzzle object is non-null, then the puzzle solution will be scrambled using the unlock code.

Specified by:
toByteArray in class PuzzleInputStream<PUZPuzzle>
Returns:
The byte[] of the serialized puzzle
Throws:
PuzzleSerializationException - An error occurred during serialization or the puzzle object contains inconsistencies that would preclude serialization
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during the serialization process

validate

public void validate()
              throws java.io.IOException
Analyzes the PUZPuzzle object associated with this input stream to determine if it can be serialized successfully or not.

Specified by:
validate in class PuzzleInputStream<PUZPuzzle>
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the puzzle cannot be serialized
